pros: The benefits and pay were great. The office environment there was great as well.
cons: Not too much room for growth, depending on the office you work in.

job_title: Executive Director, Operations in Rootstown, OH

pros: I have 2 year's good research experience here.
cons: I have no bad exprerience here.

pros: People are engaging and friendly, everyone is always willing to help or collaborate! Located in a quiet area, campus is small and contains a med school as well. Laboratory spaces are open concept in the RGE area as well as the adjacent cubicle space, makes it feel open and bright.
cons: Pay is not the best at least for tech positions, raises only every other year and bonuses every other year and they are usually somewhat small. HR can sometimes be dismissive but you can usually find that one person to help you if you are persistent. Sometimes you can lose your job with little notice due to funding. Depending on the project you are working on it can be a little difficult to find good work/life balance, but this depends greatly on who you are working for. Lack of cohesion lab to lab, experience can be very different based on what lab you are in.

pros: - All the regular benefits plus some nice extras such as shortened summer hours, on-site cafeteria, gym, doctors office, pharmacy, and coffee bar.
cons:
- A very "just always make the students happy" mentality, even when they're not right. 
- Very much a political environment. If you can't play the game, you won't make it.  People seem nice, and some are, but when it comes down to it, it's every man for themselves.

pros: After finding my passion in the higher education field, I spent countless years at other universities losing hope that they could be a balance between being competitive and driven to be the best and doing what's best for their students; cue NEOMED. Since day one, I have been engaged to learn and my voice has been heard as a younger professional than many of those who have worked here for decades. Management, faculty, and staff are student driven and focus on the greater good overall.
cons: While salary is competitive, lump sum bonuses are not as attractive as a yearly increase to reward those who put their years of service into NEOMED.

job_title: Research Coordinator II in Rootstown, OH
pros: NEOMED's President , Dr. Gershen, has made remarkable strides to promote a culture of equity, awareness and growth for students, faculty, staff and the surrounding communities.  Over the course of my employment, I was afforded the opportunities to grow not only in my career but as a whole person.  NEOMED provides their employees an optimal environment to develop skills and make meaningful connections.

review_title: Some professors expect you to be a pure workaholic
pros: The employees are nice to work with knowledgeable employers. The HR department is very professional and provided health insurance is great.
cons: Depending on the professor, you must be a workaholic and be satisfied with dismal pay that is not competitive. Be sure to know your prospective professor in advance.

review_title: Nice and peaceful but too small if you are ambitious!
pros:
Adequate salaries
Very good benefits package
Good management and nice staff
Beautiful campus, neat and well-maintained facilities
Overall, a nice place for short term.
cons:
Very small research body
The university is still under development
No public transit and very little on-the-campus services
Little chance of career development

job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Rootstown, OH
pros: In anatomy and neurobiology emphasis is given to individual time to develope Research
cons: Low name recognition for jobs in external environments

pros: Great people and environment, great way to learn new things
Quality preparation of health professionals to work in diverse communities
Free Parking, security figured out how to lock the doors after a year of trying
cons: Lack of inclusion/racism, over zealous police, clueless supervisors, chaos among departments, lack of funding.
